description:
The main character, Ranze, is a junior high girl with troubles: her father is a vampire and her mother is a werewolf. Ranze has yet to manifest her supernatural powers, and her parents are beginning to get worried she might be normal. So begins the fantasy romantic comedy story.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Werewolf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a werewolf.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Boxing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of boxing.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

name.native: アロン・ルーク・ウォーレンサー
alternative: アロン＝ルーク＝ウォーレンサー

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).
Started his career at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1963. Later went freelance to further pursue his career as a scriptwriter.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%9D%92%E6%9C%A8%E6%82%A0%E4%B8%89)

Yuuzou Aoki is a director, animator, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

He is a versatile artist and has been working as storyboarder, animation, animation checker and director.

He started his career in 1972 as illustrator for a weekly tabloid paper but quickly changed the profession and joined the animation business in 1975 where he started as inbetweener but quickly also became animator and storyboarder, all on Manga Nihon Mukashibanashi after he joined with Studio Akapan under Takahashi Ryousuke in 1978.

In 1980 he joined Shin-Ei, where his workload increased even more. 1991 was his debut as director. Today he is freelance but does work closely with Group Tac.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%9D%92%E6%9C%A8%E6%82%A0%E4%B8%89)

Yuuzou Aoki is a director, animator, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noboru_Ishiguro) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石黒昇)

Noboru Ishiguro was noteworthy for directing classic anime series like [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/), [Orguss](https://anilist.co/anime/2089/) and [Legend of the Galactic Heroes](https://anilist.co/anime/820/).

He was in a Hawaiian-style music band in his youth. Therefore, he is known as an animation director who can actually read musical scores and has made the best use of his previous experience for works such as [Macross: Do You Remember Love?](https://anilist.co/anime/1089/) and Legend of the Galactic Heroes. He entered Nihon University in the Department of Art and graduated in 1964. He joined Onishi Pro where he first worked as a key animator on subcontracted Astro Boy episodes. In 1978, he founded [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/) for which he served as an executive director until he passed away in 2012.
Co-founder of animation studio Doga Kobo.
